title: Collaborative Strategies for Instructional Design Teams in Open Educational Resource Development

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in developing adult literacy education materials and basic knowledge of secondary mathematics education
context.additional_context: A collaborative process where current practitioners design and develop open math educational materials in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Instructional design teams can execute the open educational resource development phase by dividing it into six core activities: needs analysis, content structuring, prototype development, feedback collection, iterative revision, and final validation
Participants can efficiently communicate with team members in asynchronous environments using digital collaboration tools
Learners can explain licensing selection criteria considering copyright issues when designing OER in blended environments

resources: Sample Math Education Content for Adult Learners

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
